py_sim.launch.vector_field_nav module¶

vector_field_nav.py: Provides sample vector fields used for navigation

class py_sim.launch.vector_field_nav.NavVectorFollower(initial_state: UnicycleStateType, dynamics: Dynamics[UnicycleStateType, InputType], controller: VectorControl[UnicycleStateType, InputType, ControlParamType], control_params: ControlParamType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[UnicycleStateType], vector_field: VectorField, world: PolygonWorld, sensor: RangeBearingSensor)¶

Bases: Generic[UnicycleStateType, InputType, ControlParamType], SingleAgentSim[UnicycleStateType]

Framework for implementing a simulator that uses a vector field for feedback control through a polygon world with a distance measurement

dynamics¶

The dynamics function to be used for simulation

Type:

Dynamics[UnicycleStateType, InputType]

controller¶

The control law to be used during simulation

Type:

Control[UnicycleStateType, InputType, ControlParamType]

control_params¶

The parameters of the control law to be used in simulation

Type:

ControlParamType

vector_field¶

Vector field that the vehicle will follow

Type:

VectorField

world¶

World in which the vehicle is operating

Type:

PolygonWorld

sensor¶

The sensor used for detecting obstacles

Type:

RangeBearingSensor

update() → None¶

Calls all of the update functions.

Updates performed:

  • Calculate the range and bearing measurements

  • Calculate the resulting vector to be followed

  • Calculate the control to be executed

  • Update the state

  • Update the time

py_sim.launch.vector_field_nav.run_simple_vectorfield_example() → None¶

Runs an example of a go-to-goal vector field combined with obstacle avoidance to show off the sensor measurements being performed
